p: Six surveys of health professionalsâ€™ perceptions of and knowledge about climate change have been done in non-English-speaking nations. They include Ethiopian health science students [ 23], Indian medical residents [ 24], Cambodian health professionals [ 25], Chinese hospital-based nurses [ 26], and Chinese public health professionals [ 27, 28]. In all cases, a large majority of respondents perceived that climate change is harmful to health, but their self-assessed knowledge was low, and their perceived need to learn more was high.
